info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 4:47PM EDT until July 12 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following county, in central Ohio, Licking.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 447 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newark, Heath, Granville, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Utica, Hanover, Marne, Harbor Hills, Thornport, Granville South, Fairfield Beach, Kirkersville, St. Louisville, Gratiot, Interstate 70 at State Route 13, Purity, Toboso, Brownsville and Fallsburg.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING
